Html:
Hello,

when will the NuGet packages updated? They are currently still in the state of 1.6.0

Thank you for your hard work.

*sry

i do not own the NO nuget/github packages. what i can i do is try to contact these guys.
in progress

:/ WM_CALLBACK

Wow, this is great news. I didn't see Sebastian released v1.7.0 of NetOffice.

I'll try to update the NuGet packages on Saturday night.

PS: @Sebastian, I'm happy to give you commit rights to the GitHub repo if you want to.

Great news,

thanks to all guys for your hard work.
I use netoffice since more than two years. Such a great wrapper, without netoffice I would despair.
I'm interested in the answer on this one as well. It looks like the publish date on nuget is over a year ago. Who do we ask to get that updated?
Guys, I've just updated the NuGet packages to v1.7.2 on the nuget,org feed. Let me know if you find any issues.

@CaioProiete

have a look to the deployment table

http://netoffice.codeplex.com/documentation (scroll down)

to show the correct dependencies.

( MSProject is missing in the deployment table. its:

MSProject
  • NetOffice
  • OfficeApi
  • VBIDEApi
  • MSHTMLApi
    )
*Sebastian

Hi Sebastian,

Just so I understand: You are saying I should include VBIDEApi in the MSProject NuGet packages?

I already include all the others described in the deployment table:


Cheers,
Caio Proiete

ooops, now i see MSProject is part of the deployment table and its wrong!
MSProject use the VBIDEApi too. my bad, i want fix the documentation.
please add VBIDEApi to the MSProject dependencies.

*Sebastian

@Sebastian: I've just checked and we are good...

VBIDEApi is already included in all packages (as they depend on NetOffice.Core, which includes NetOffice.dll, OfficeApi.dll, and VBIDEApi.dll

Cheers,
Caio Proiete
